functions.population.visualization¶

Module for visualization of data and results related to population estimation.

Module Contents¶

functions.population.visualization.plot_folds(df, figsize=(4.5, 9), bbox=(1.75, 1))¶

Return spatial plot of validation folds.

functions.population.visualization.get_tiles(x, y, roi, tiles_path)¶

Return (img,buildings) pair of numpy arrays for roi survey tile (y,x).

functions.population.visualization.get_tiles_df(df, i, tiles_path)¶

Return (img,buildings) pair of numpy arrays for dataframe row i.

functions.population.visualization.prediction_error(df, true='pop', pred='pop_pred', var=None, ax=None, images=False, buildings=False, tiles_path=None, color=True, show_metrics=False, lim=None)¶

Plot predicted (df[pred]) vs observed (df[true]) values from dataframe, optionally plot error bars (var = True) and tile images/buildings over points.

functions.population.visualization.to_img(buildings, threshold=0.5)¶

Visdualize building footprint estimates as image with transparent background where buildings <= threshold.

functions.population.visualization.merge(image, buildings, threshold=0.5)¶

Overlay building estimates (where > threshold) over image of tile.

functions.population.visualization.display_pair(img, buildings, axarr=None, points=None)¶

Plot three images: img, buildings, and buildings overlayed on img.

functions.population.visualization.to_pdf(survey, roi, tiles_path, out_path, points=None, coords=None, outliers=None)¶

Output pdf displaying population labeled survey tiles.

functions.population.visualization.get_colors(n, offset=0.7)¶

Get colormap for n features.

functions.population.visualization.feature_importance(models, features, colors, crop=True, n_show=10)¶

Plot feature importance for model as bar chart.
